intro: Obione malvana, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Obione malvana is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
